6.2 Payments. All payments hereunder shall be payable to IMNTV in United States Dollars on a quarterly basis upon receipt from the wireless carriers in the Territory, except as follows:
(a) First Payment. The first payment to IMNTV will be payable upon receipt at the end of the first calendar quarter after Launch, and will include any amounts due, pro-rated based on the number of days in such period of time; and
(b) Last Payment. The last payment to IMNTV will be payable upon receipt at the end of the first full month after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, and will include any amounts due: for the last month that the Programming is available, prorated based on the number of days in such final period.
(c) Other Exceptions. All payments hereunder are exclusive of: (i) any trial or promotional periods during which a Subscriber receives access to the Programming before such Subscriber’s credit card is charged; and (ii) refunds, charge backs and fees attributable to contested credit card transactions
(d) Summary of Timing. The parties acknowledge the following that establishes timing of payments: (1) Distributor receives a carrier statement saying how much Distributor will be paid; (2) 30-45 days later the Carrier pays Distributor; (3) when Distributor is paid by a carrier, Distributor makes royalty payments to IMNTV.
(e) Exchange Rate. Payments to IMNTV will be converted from local currency to US Dollars at the official exchange rate posted on the day payments are made to IMNTV via wire transfer provided that currency exchange is approved by the relevant Chinese currency exchange administrative agency.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.2 Payments. All payments hereunder shall be payable to IMNTV in United States Dollars on a quarterly basis upon receipt from the wireless carriers in the Territory, except as follows:
(a) First Payment. The first payment to IMNTV will be payable upon receipt at the end of the first calendar quarter after Launch, and will include any amounts due, without any pro-ration based on the number of days in such period of time; and
(b) Last Payment. The last payment to IMNTV will be payable upon receipt at the end of the third full month after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, and will include any amounts due: for the last three months that the Programming is available, without any proration based on the number of days in such final period.
(c) Other Exceptions. All payments hereunder are exclusive of: (i) any trial or promotional periods during which a Subscriber receives access to the Programming before such Subscriber’s credit card is charged; and (ii) refunds, charge backs and fees attributable to contested credit card transactions
(d) Summary of Timing. The parties acknowledge the following that establishes timing of payments: (1) Distributor receives a carrier statement saying how much Distributor will be paid; (2) 30-45 days later the Carrier pays Distributor; (3) when Distributor is paid by a carrier, Distributor makes royalty payments to IMNTV.
(e) Exchange Rate. Payments to IMNTV will be converted from local currency to US Dollars at the average exchange rate of the last month of the calendar quarter posted on the day payments are made to IMNTV via wire transfer, regardless of whether currency exchange is approved by the relevant Chinese currency exchange administrative agency.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment terms. The first payment is changed to 'without any pro-ration,' contradicting the initial statement of 'pro-rated based on the number of days.' Also, the 'Last Payment' has been changed to 'third full month' instead of 'first full month' after termination and 'last three months' instead of 'last month' without pro-ration. Finally, the payments to IMNTV will be converted at the average exchange rate of the last month of the calendar quarter, no matter if it is approved by the administrative agency, making it contradict with the last sentence.

perturbation.original_text: 6.5 Reporting. Distributor will provide IMNTV with a quarterly report or monthly report if available, summarizing the data relevant to the payment obligations herein within five (5) business days from the end of the calendar quarter. The reports will contain sufficient information to permit Provider to verify payments hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.5 Reporting. Distributor will provide IMNTV with a quarterly report, summarizing the data relevant to the payment obligations herein within thirty (30) business days from the end of the calendar quarter. However, the reports will not contain any information to permit Provider to verify payments hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the reporting terms. The deadline is changed to thirty (30) business days from five (5) business days, making it a less strict deadline. Also, the sentence now states that reports won't contain any information to verify the payments, contradicting the purpose of the report.

perturbation.original_text: 9.5 Force Majeure. No party shall be deemed in default hereunder for any cessation, interruption or delay in the performance of its obligations due to causes beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to: earthquake, flood, or other natural disaster, act of God, labor controversy, civil disturbance, war (whether or not officially declared) or the inability to obtain sufficient supplies, transportation, or other essential commodity or service required in the conduct of its business, or any change in or the adoption of any law, regulation, judgment or decree (each a “Force Majeure Event”). Each party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if any Force Majeure Event of another party continues for more than ten (10) days.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.5 Force Majeure. No party shall be deemed in default hereunder for any cessation, interruption or delay in the performance of its obligations due to causes within its reasonable control, including but not limited to: mismanagement, financial difficulties, or strategic errors. Each party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement after providing a three-month notice period if any Force Majeure Event of another party continues for more than one-hundred-twenty (120) days.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that a party is not in default for causes beyond their control, while the modified clause suggests they are not in default for causes *within* their control, which is contradictory. The termination clause is also modified, extending the waiting period to one-hundred-twenty (120) days and three-month notice period. This creates an internal conflict, as it is now unclear under what conditions a party is actually considered in default due to external events.
